intro: Streptocarpus heckmannianus subsp. heckmannianus, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last several months under suitable conditions.
